Vendito Consulting Group is a specialised sales recruitment agency that believes in putting people first. When it comes to hiring exceptional talent, we’re not middlemen, we’re matchmakers. 

We are committed to leveraging self-development, continued education, and hands-on dedication to make sure that every sales position we recruit is a success.

We walk alongside your business as a partner in the process and frame every search through the lens of your unique benefits and value. 

Industry-leading marketing, recruitment, vetting, resources and interviewing processes allow us to find high-performing candidates that have the right experience, mindset, and vision to take your business to the next level.

general.headline: Strategy, marketing and content that grows innovative firms.
general.description:
I'm a passionate marketing and content expert with a love for helping firms and owners grow successful businesses. Professionally I've been a lawyer, international recruiter, business owner, podcaster, writer and marketer! I have over 15 years experience advising leading professional services businesses around the world. Starting out as a solicitor at a top tier law firm before moving into recruitment and subsequently Beyond Billables I have been fortunate enough to work with lawyers and firms in over 30 different countries around the world. With Beyond Billables I bring my drive for helping professionals grow their businesses with a love for helping individual owners achieve their ambitions. I am passionate about helping innovative and disruptive firms, legal technology companies, legal services providers and progressive corporations  (and the owners that power them) grow their brand, attract more clients and find success that is meaningful. 

With Maciek I am the co-host of two podcasts, "The More than Marketing Show", and the “Beyond Billables” podcasts. 

Outside of work I'm a dedicated father of two and an avid martial artist. I train Brazilian Jiu Jitsu and get to hold my pants up with a purple belt. I also trained Ukidokan kickboxing under Sensei Nadine Champion. I'm a big believer in the importance of health and wellness and am determined to help other professionals find more time to look after themselves. 

For me having a business has to fulfil the vision I have as an owner. I love spending my time helping other like minded owners who want to take their business to the next level do exactly that.

jobs.description:
We're career managers and change agents, helping lawyers achieve their goals, in life and at work.

Check out our podcast at https://beyondbillables.com/podcast-for-lawyers/

What doe we do?

* We are building a platform for lawyers to find new roles they love in a #newlaw, legal technology companies, the “gig” economy, progressive firms and companies looking to hire lawyers for non legal roles. 
* We help firms and startups grow by attracting, hiring and retaining the best possible people.
* We provide advice, coaching, content and programs to help lawyers have better lives, better health and better careers. 
* We help friends, friends of friends, and other like minded lawyers who want our personal assistance finding a new role anywhere in the wold. 

The legal profession is rapidly changing and we want to help lawyers better deal with this change and growing firms build amazing businesses. At a macro level new technology like AI, organisational disruption, outsourcing and a change to what it even means to be a lawyer are driving a revolution in legal practice. At a more personal level lawyers are widely unhappy, overworked, unsatisfied and increasingly struggling to balance the rigours of practice with a desire to live a well rounded life.

That's where we come in. Beyond Billables is partnering with firms and startups to bridge the gap between their desire to grow, and their ability to attract, hire and retain the best people. All the while providing a platform for individual lawyers to understand and take advantage of these opportunities, and have healthier and more rewarding careers. 

We've blown up the old model and put partnership, collaboration, growth and the wellbeing at the centre. 

If you're interested in helping lawyers in their careers, lives and health, and can make a contribution, please get in touch at michael@beyondbillables.com  or reach out on linkedin.

Our approach is simple. We work with the world’s leading law firms. We help the world’s leading lawyers and business services professionals. Ultimately, we bring the two together. 

Do I have options to work overseas? What should I do to position myself for promotion? How do I approach my next review? Can someone provide third party advice at different points of my career? If you’re a lawyer with these questions we should connect and have a confidential chat.  

Do you need the best legal mind for a team with high expectations? Do you want an open, direct and thorough service? Do you have questions about candidate’s skills or experience from a certain jurisdiction but no one to ask? Do you want to know what is happening in the legal market around the world? If you’re a partner or legal professional working at a leading firm we can help.

I'm a business owner, global career manager, former lawyer, proud father and Jiujiteiro. I value commitment, openness, discipline, humour and honesty. These values are all reflected in my approach to life and business. I love connecting great lawyers with the world's best law firms and helping them pursue outstanding careers.

general.headline: Founder, Vanguard Partners
general.description:
Zak Beer is the Founder and Managing Director of Vanguard Partners.

With over 10 years experience advising clients on Talent Acquisition, Zak holds a rare and unique blend of capability working with both the world’s largest specialist recruitment agency and a global executive search firm – with experience recruiting roles from graduates through to leading full-scale global searches at the C-Suite and Partner level.

He has built unparalleled expertise and loyal clientele within the Australian professional services market – acting as a trusted advisor on all matters Talent and Recruitment.

In 2014 Zak founded Vanguard Partners, a specialist Talent Consulting firm. 

Operating purely within niche verticals, Vanguard Partners are spearheading the new direction within the Recruitment industry. 

Recruitment has become ‘transactional’ – our goal is to bring the personal element back into finding an outstanding individual for our clients or in talent managing an outstanding individual’s career.

Learn more at: www.vanguardpartners.com.au

jobs.description:
We are Vanguard Partners – Your Partners in Talent Consulting and Recruitment.

We are deeply connected in your market – Each of our consultants are experts in their market, penetrating niche specialist verticals we hold deeply forged long-term relationships with leaders and individuals within your field.

We are contemporary and creative – We adopt unparalleled social media strategies to reach the top talent within our markets and are nimble enough to use creativity in tailoring our service to not only each client but also each and every engagement.

We don’t work with everyone – We value our clients business and loyalty, therefore we don’t work with every firm or organisation within the market – we exclusively strengthen our clients business, brand and deliver them the best talent within their market.

We believe in people – We understand the sheer rawness of our jobs and how our advice can alter a person’s direction and destination; therefore we take our jobs seriously. We are passionate and follow through with the most appropriate and effective approach tailored to you, to ensure you reach your goals.

We have the best consultants – Big call, but we believe it. Our staff value proposition is second to none, and we adopt the same thorough strategies and approach in attracting and retaining our own consultants as we advise our clients on, therefore you will be impressed and even surprised with the level of service, integrity and insight each of our consultants will give you.

We can’t wait to work with you – We are passionate about what we do and we will work extremely hard for you – finding you the right person means so much more to us than simply filling the ‘job brief’, forming a long term relationship as your trusted advisor and partner in recruitment is paramount to us.

Follow us on all social media platforms to keep up to date with our latest exclusive opportunities: #vanguardpartners

general.headline: Endocrinologist | PhD Candidate - Artificial Pancreas & T1D Technology - at St Vincent's Hospital
general.description:
I am an Endocrinologist with specific clinical and research interests in Type 1 Diabetes, diabetes technology and management of T1DM during exercise.  My research interests include investigating ways to improve the lives of people with T1DM through the development of the artificial pancreas, novel diabetes technologies, mathematical modelling and exercise physiology in T1DM.

I am currently working as an Endocrinologist and Research Fellow at St Vincent’s Hospital, Melbourne and consulting with Melbourne Physicians Group in North Melbourne.  I am completing a PhD through the University of Melbourne focusing on enhancing the artificial pancreas and novel diabetes technologies for T1DM with a specific focus on exercise.

# Clinical interests and experience: care of patients with type 1 diabetes, management of exercise in T1DM, management of diabetes technology. Care of patients with other endocrinological conditions including thyroid, bone, pituitary, adrenal and other hormonal disruptions

# Research skills: design and implementation of clinical trials, exercise studies, mathematical modelling, diabetes technology trials, data analysis, statistical modelling, medical care of trial participants

# Coding experience: Matlab, Visual Basic, R, Stata

# Sporting experience: Victorian Women's State Ice Hockey team, Victorian State Synchronized Swimming team, Australian University Marathon Championships, triathlon, aerial silks & pole acrobatics, downhill & cross country skiing, yoga, pilates

general.headline: Clinical Psychology Registrar at the Alfred Hospital - Headspace & Private
general.description:
Noah Has over eight years’ experience in counseling, and currently completed a placement at Geelong West Community Mental Health Service Belmont where he experienced working in a multidisciplinary team and conducted a vast range of responsibilities. From intake assessments, case formulations risk assessments, providing provisional diagnosis, report writing and providing CBT.

Throughout Noah's career and studies he learned the importance of an interprofessional collaborative approach and throughout my military service acquired resilience, coping skills and flexibility. Noah's previous jobs and studies provided him with knowledge of mental illness, main types of assessments, treatments, therapies, and targeted interventions with their contributions to recovery-oriented services.
Noah strives to support and facilitate clients’ use of resilience and strength so that they might experience positive self-image, hope and motivation, and live the lifestyle of their choice. Noah aims to do so in a warm, empathetic and compassionate manner. Noah is curious about people and about mental illness and endeavor to learn more about it. Noah admitted feeling fortunate to be able to use his skills and knowledge to assist and support people in need. He aims to communicate and demonstrate respect for clients’ autonomy, rights, and responsibilities, and view this skill as a being a significant contributor for individual’s recovery. In addition to his academic and work experiences, he also possess a great deal of patience, well developed communication skills, reliability, integrity, and respect for people and confidentiality.

Being from a different culture Noah is aware of issues relating to cultural diversity and how these may influence service, communication and in turn recovery. Noah strives to promote a friendly, respectful and supportive environment for clients and team members.

Barwon Health's Adult Mental Health Services provide community and in-patient services for people aged between 26 and 65 years, affected by serious complex mental illness. My role is part of a field student placement, and my duties and responsibilities are observed by a field supervisor.
The role entails:

 CBT
 Intake assessments
 Mental Status Examinations
 Risk assessments
 Report writing
 Providing provisional diagnosis
 Outreach to clients of Belmont Health Community Mental Health Service
 Case presentations
 Knowledge of TCM (Barwon health’s management system)

Inner-view is an Australian private counseling company, devoted to help individuals
      
      achieve their personal and professional goals.

The Gene Carmella Mankowitz Fund was founded in memory of my late mother who was a Clinical Psychologist who worked in mental health. The Gene Carmella Mankowitz Fund is a center that provides individuals diagnosed with mental disorders (e.g., Schizophrenia, Autism, and personality disorders) and their family with support and financial aid. This is achieved by providing individuals with a full day of activities (painting, pottery, and jewelry making) accompanied with group and individual therapy. At the end of each term, all completed projects are sold in an auction and the earnings are divided between the center and their individual’s family as part of the financial aid goal. The center employs Psychiatrists, Clinical Psychologists, and Social workers.

general.description:
►I AM PASSIONATE ABOUT LIFE 

Gilles is a dedicated French Medical Doctor. He is on a mission to look after people health so that they are able to function and participate in the community and reach their full potential. His practice gathers the latest knowledge in medicine, a strong care coordination, a comprehensive wellness awareness and life education.

 He has honed through his experience some valuable medical skills such as medical cross-thinking, effective problem analysis and decision-making techniques. When being the first medical contact for a person with an undiagnosed health concern, those tools become very valuable. This is a holistic approach of medicine aiming to take into consideration the clinical, biological, psychological and social factors relevant to the care of each patient's illness..

 After undergoing his Medical Studies at the prestigious Medical Faculty of Montpellier, which is also the oldest Medical Faculty in the world, Gilles went to the University of Reims where his thesis received very honorable with the congratulation of the jury distinction. He was also granted an award for his dissertation on the Burn-out and its life impact.

Gilles has a deep interest in philosophy where the primary concern is the questioning of reality, existence, knowledge, values, reason, mind, language and life.

She is also co-creator and clinical director of Taylor Clinic , Dr ink tattoo removal and Australian Allergy Centre  and collective.care as well as Clinical creator of Brand -Aid, Australia's first physician-owned medical digital media marketing company.

general.headline: Interventional Endoscopist, Sydney Gastroenterology
general.description:
Sydney Gastroenterology
www.sydneygi.com.au

Dr Darren Pavey is an Interventional Endoscopist with extensive clinical experience in the endoscopic diagnosis and management of gastrointestinal cancers. His clinical practice is enhanced by his interest in clinical outcomes research for endoscopic management of GI malignancies.

Dr Pavey completed an Advanced Fellowship in ERCP, EUS and Interventional Endoscopy at Duke University in North Carolina; he was a Faculty member at Duke until he returned to Sydney to establish his practice in 2008.

Dr Pavey is Co-Chair, Gastroenterology Network, NSW Agency for Clinical Innovation (ACI), and Head of Endoscopy at Bankstown Hospital. He established and runs the Barrett’s Program in the South West Sydney Local Health District and has co-written the guidelines for the Cancer Council of NSW for the treatment of Barrett’s Esophagus. Dr Pavey is the Royal Australasian College of Physicians (RACP) representative on the Conjoint Committee for the Recognition of Training in Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (CCRTGE), which reflects his ongoing interests in training and maintaining quality in endoscopy. He is also closely involved in the research of outcomes for patients with esophageal, gastric, pancreatic and bowel cancers and collaborates with the Australian Gastrointestinal Trials Group (AGITG) and other researcher institutions, including the Garvan Research Institute and the Ingham Institute.

He is Conjoint Senior Lecturer at the University of New South Wales and Clinical Senior Lecturer at Macquarie University.

general.headline: Consultation-Liaison and Addiction Psychiatrist, Currumbin Clinic
general.school: Royal Australian and New Zealand College of Psychiatrists
general.description:
Dr MacDonald works primarily at Currumbin Clinic, providing inpatient and outpatient services for his patients, which includes consideration of individual psychotherapy, medication and neuro-stimulation. He is passionate about employing the principles of the "recovery" paradigm in mental health care delivery, such as empowerment of the patient in determining both personal and clinical recovery goals, and supported decision making. Some of Dr MacDonald’s specific clinical areas of interests include addiction psychiatry, adult ADHD, mood disorders and psychopharmacology.

He graduated with first class honours through Monash University and with the Geoff Conron Prize in Psychiatry, then trained at The Alfred, Melbourne and St Patrick’s Hospital, Dublin. Dr MacDonald’s curiosity about the interface between medicine and psychiatry led him to train in Consultation-Liaison psychiatry and complete research in the area of conversion disorder. He was an Adjunct Lecturer for Monash University, and has received prizes for writing online learning modules for medical students. He has been actively engaged in tertiary consultation for a number of health services in Melbourne before he moved to the Gold Coast in 2014 where he worked as the Northern Community Clinical Lead for Gold Coast HHS.

As a Consultation-Liaison Psychiatrist, he has become more accustomed to balancing competing interests, collaborating broadly with staff of varying disciplines, understanding how clinical and management staff interact within complex operational systems, and supervising staff of different professional backgrounds. He has an interest in teaching and research, which includes presenting educational topics to clinical and non-clinical staff in an effort to promote mental health literacy in our community. 

Dr MacDonald was previously a state-level cricket player, runs marathons occasionally despite acquiring numerous injuries, and was a hopeless rugby player.

general.headline: Director and Founder of Business for Doctors
general.description:
Rural GP with a business passion.. As an advocate for Medical Practitioners in business and finance opportunities continue to arise to assist and grow the Business for Doctors Community. Business for Doctors is now the latest growing online community of doctors from various specialities and practice levels. My role in negotiating group discounts, partnership opportunities and expanding the business into importing products and financial services. 

Using the skill set developed from early business and finance industry exposure, to the writing and communications learned at Medical School, my endeavour is to continue to grow a network of business people who have a common goal for success with integrity. 

With skills in Rural Procedural Medicine, O&G, Mental Health, Emergency Medicine, Critical Care Medicine, Education, Telehealth and Medical Education this provides an excellent base for a successful business career and the perfect platform to launch a network of business education for Doctors. 
A supportive community member as a Rotarian offering assistance with local and world-wide projects. A Mentor in Medicine and Business to over 18500 Doctors and most importantly a mother of 3 and grandmother of 2.

jobs.description:
Co-Directing this start-up finance business has been an opportunity to enter into the
      financial business world. With the growing numbers of Doctors and Dentists looking for
      faster, smarter and more powerful ways to manage their financial obligations BFD
      finance brings the values of BFD to the negotiating table.
      

    This opportunity allows practitioners to give back to a charity of choice and/or BFD at
      
      not cost to them

Business for Doctors was established in 2015 as a social media group in recognition of the need to educate and empower medical practitioners in the business of medicine. Traditionally a taboo topic, doctors are increasingly recognising the pitfalls of having little or no knowledge of personal and professional money management, including taxation, investment and business structure.

The group page has been designed to established confidence in the members by closing the group to non-doctors. This allows members to express personal opinions or concerns more freely than may otherwise occur. Members are encouraged to help direct the activities of the group and administrators are guided by the group’s collective voice.

The extension into the Business For Doctors webpage incorporates the development of knowledge in all sectors of business, banking and finance for both individuals and Medical Practitioners. In addition to knowledge the group has now the capacity to seek buying offers and discounts. Projected savings for the 2017/18 year are over $5 million in air travel alone. 

In 2017 the inaugural Business For Doctors conference was held at the RACV Melbourne. In 2018 BFD18 was be held in Sydney at the Four Seasons with over 400 attendees. BFD19 will be held at the Hilton in Brisbane. 

Business for Doctors has provided work-balance-family opportunities with our overseas and cruise workshops. In 2017 and 2018 we help Fiji workshops and a P&O cruise ship weekend. In 2019 we look forward to the BFD Japan - Niseko Hilton.  

Business for Doctors is always seeking new opportunities to link Doctors with business transaction, and has negotiated alliances with reputable businesses such as Virgin Australia, Tego Insurance, Employsure, GE Health and more to offer excellent services and savings to our members .

Mandurah obstetrics is a privately operated and funded GP specialist clinic servicing the Peel Region. As a new 1/3 owner of the practice I have been fortunate to implement changes to expand services and practitioners as to add to the mix already on offer. The practice offers speciality care for low and medium risk patients who wish to deliver in the Peel Region or shared care services for Perth based obstetric services. 
Services in gynaecology, infertility, menopause and men's sexual health allow practitioners to maintain a broad base skill set within their chosen speciality. 
The practice services Peel Health Campus O&G clinics and theatre lists as well as supporting midwife practitioners.
It is with great pleasure I can refer Goldfields patients to Peel Health Campus & Mandurah Obstetric, either for direct of shared care services. We have a great team and offer comprehensive services to compliment Collins Street Surgery

Opportunity knocks! 
Being at the forefront in the development of new concepts in rural practice is an exciting time. General practice has never been so challenging, with the regulations, limitations, restrictions and workforce shortage, been different is not about a change, its about survival! 

My new role has now extended to the reopening and restructuring of a previously successful medical centre. Limited opportunities to engage rural doctors encourages us to think outside the square and find other ways to entice these practitioners to the community as well as developing means of coping with higher patient loads without reducing the quality of the medical services. 

I continue to offer antenatal and obstetric services, general medical services, nursing home visits allowing for continuity of care for Collins street patients.  Working closely with our practice nurses we are able to develop and coordinate a model of care the best suits the needs of our patients.

Collins Street Surgery offers quality medical care and support services in the Goldfields region. With the expansion of the practice into Occupational Health and Safety, Travel Medicine and Skin cancer prevention the practice offers a complete health care at one convenient location.

Opportunities are available for General Practitioners interested in building a successful business in a regional area.

Continuing on the pathway of Rural Medicine a new process of work placement and services has been developed. The company provides medical services to rural and remote areas within Australia for short and long term periods. 
Rural medical services require ongoing support and offering such services allows diversification of skill sets and an opportunity to re-locate and 'try before you buy' -
I would encourage other rural doctors who are able to be mobile to consider the opportunities offered in rural practice and supporting our rural colleagues.

jobs.jobTitle: Intensive Care Unit - Staff Medical Officer
jobs.description:
Ashford Hospital is renowned for its Cardiac and Intensive Care Units.
A diverse role that continues to develop and practice the art of acute medicine in a private hospital setting. With consultant support for ICU, and 24 hour contactable private consultants, Ashford allows the practitioner to work independently to manage acute care patients and arrange follow up with experienced private consultants in all areas. The primary role of the SMO is to manage the minute to minute needs of the acute and chronically ill inpatient with remote support from various specialties. 
As MET team leader ongoing skill sets in Airway skills is needed to manage acute emergencies. 
 
The role includes emergency and on-site overnight care of 180 inpatients including High Dependency Unit, Obstetrics and post-operative patients.

Working on a regular basis to enhance surgical and clinical skills in Obstetrics and Womens Health, Peel Health is a fantastic working environment offering diverse clinical and surgical experiences. In conjunction with Mandurah Obstetrics this position opens doors for connecting with up and coming trainees and linking the Goldfields to opportunities in the Mandurah region.
Peel Health offers quality private and public services with experienced qualified GP specialists and Specialist O&G.

Mildura Base Hospital
Having previously worked in Mildura an opportunity to locum as a direct employee from April 2016 has reopened opportunities in various speciality areas. 
Concurrently working in Kalgoorlie, Mandurah and Adelaide - Mildura offers opportunity for teaching and learning, teamwork, upskilling and interaction with various health and allied health professionals.

Working in a Small Rural Practice allowed for the development of communication and clinical skills as well as building relationships with patients and families in the community. 
Clare offered a unique opportunity of varied medicine, emergency skills, radiology, obstetrics, general practice and inpatient services. 
There were also plenty of opportunities to teach medical students and junior staff as well as running high school education sessions for year 12 female students.
Intensive Care Medicine, Bundaberg Hospital

Mildura Base Hospital
Emergency Medicine - night doctor 
Servicing a region of over 40'000 people was challenging with limited resources and staff - but what team. The nursing staff at this department are some of the most competent and skilled I have ever worked with. 
This Locum position was 10 hour night shifts 14 nights on, 7 off, roster.
Obstetrics and Gynaecology Registrar
Neonatal Medicine, Women's Emergency Medicine, Obstetrics
Vascular Surgery, Upper GI Surgery, AAU, Emergency Medicine, Geriatrics

jobs.companyName: Wide Bay Hospital and Health Service
jobs.description:
Third year started and we move onto greater aspirations. 18 week clinical pathways are finally the vogue and driving delivery specialty by specialty. Building on a fantastic strategic plan supported by a board who are creative, innovative and challenging, we strive to become not only the best in Queensland, but the best in Australia. Extensive redesign and management development taking place. Launch of training and education strategy which underpins our strategic direction. Delivering excellence in quality care, by developing the very best clinical governance process and systems. Engaging continually the community we serve as we move forward

Year 4
Fantastic close to last year. outpatient waits dropping like as a stone,msurgical waits dropped from three years to six months and falling. Loads of developments building wise, new services brought to the region to stop our community travelling; Interventional cardiology, ophthalmology and radiation oncology. Two new oral health and cancer centres 

Year 5
All moving in the right direction. Excellent clinical governance, waiting lists and financial performance. Cannot believe we now do 92,000 units compared to 54,000 in 2012 and with fewer people. More patient better quality, more of the same to come

Health care consulting group specializing in turnaround, clinical governance review, operational redesign and strategy and planning development, clinical and process improvement redesign.
Specialist in all major techniques, experienced in development of strategic, operational and redesign plans in differing organisations.

Assignments at Peterborough & Stamford Hospitals, NHS Improvement, Papworth Hospital, East of England Quality Observatory.

jobs.jobTitle: National Lead for the Development of Quality Accounts for the NHS
jobs.description: Piloted quality accounts development within all organisations in EoE with a view to developing the supporting framework for the delivery of quality accounts across the NHS England. Quality accounts was introduced to legislation in England in January 2010, along with a clinical redesign supporting framework. Having worked with 35 Boards to deliver the pilot programme, plus advising to many others across England the programme provides a solid base on which to improve the quality of care in the health system

jobs.companyName: James Paget University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
jobs.description:
To lead the Trust whilst developing and implementing a strategy befitting of the populations needs. Develop excellent relationships with partner organizations to ensure continuous development of service. Raise the profile of the Trust to that commensurate with University Hospital status. James Paget Hospital has a population base of 230,000 and employs 2,300 staff.

Delivery of the first 6 week one stop pathway across all specialties within the organisation, from GP referral to surgical event. Surplus financial performance exceeding 15% of annual turnover, Achieved highest possible quality recognition from the HCC rated at excellent/excellent. Publication of "How to avoid a CDiff outbreak in health care", which became a national guide reference for all hospitals in England. Also won cleanest hospital of the year award in 2008

A two year turnaround that exceeded the expectation of Monitor the health foundation Trust regulator. Rated 3rd in England at the time of my departure.

The National Heart Improvement Programme was established to build upon the clinical engagement of the service improvement programmes of the CHD Collaborative. Its brief was to develop Cardiac Networks consisting of clinical leaders, managers, commissioners etc. to develop geographical strategic plans for cardiac development and sustainability. The cardiac networks would bring together commissioning, planning, quality and process improvement, workforce and information into one forum. Within England there would be 30 Clinical networks each with a population of approximately 1.8 million.

Led the development of 6 Sigma, Lean, Clinical Microsystems, Process re-engineering, Discovery Interviews within the NHS, trialling methodologies within cardiac improvement projects. Latterly led the development of fast and smart works in partnership with Sigma works ltd.

Over 60 published documents recognised internationally. Presented in many countries including USA, Canada, Czech, Finland, Australia, New Zealand, etc

Acted as advisor to Minister of Health, British Columbia to develop a strategy for Health redesign within British Columbia

Lectured for Harvard and Stamford Universities in regard to process improvement activity and developing a strategy for a country wide service improvement programme.

Outcomes: Mortality related cardiovascular disease fell from 130,000 to 68,000, saving 52,000 lives per annum. Waiting times for whole clinical pathways fell from 7.5 years to 18 weeks, with an average of 10 weeks. Education system underpinning the development of specialist personnel established to provide specialist staff to meet future demand. Patient and community engagement in clinical redesign programmes. Development of a project management system to share activity and enable learning across the country. Not many CE's can lay claim to saving this number of lives. Makes me extremely proud of those in my team that contributed to a wonderful time in my career.

To develop a strategy for delivering of service improvement activity using IHI methodology with every NHS organization in England. 
To appoint an executive board and clinical champions team representative of all cardiac services. 
To train and develop and national team of service improvement coaches that would deliver both projects and training to all organisations.
To develop and maintain information systems capable of supporting the strategy
To develop communication strategy to engage all parties associated with cardiac care which included Health Minister, Prime Ministers Delivery Team, Royal Colleges, Royal Societies, Charities, Unions, Patient forums etc.
To establish an international medical innovation network to ensure NSF direction could be updated to reflect medical developments.

Best achievement = A single national project minimising the number of bed days associated with patients awaiting cardiac investigation in tertiary centres. 1 Million investment reaped a 959 bed gain equating to over £1.3 billion recurring saving. This programme was delivered in 15 months. This is the single most productive improvement programme in health care in the world in terms of both return on investment and patient outcome.

Other outcomes: 5000 individual projects associated with CHD clinical pathway development to deliver the CHD National Service Framework. Over 50 publications demonstrating examples of "how to" improve health care. Leading the development of improvement methodologies and adapting them to public health to deliver best results.

Acknowledgements to a special team: Sheelagh (the patient comes first), Ian (a picture paints a thousand words), Garry (the organiser, mr detail), Jane (the networker), Julie (the hitwoman, nailed it every time), Cath ( miss communication) and a special assistant Rhianon....you delivered it all and more.

Divisional manager of 10 Directorates including cardiac, neurosciences, renal, emergency care.
Managed a budget in excess of £180m, delivered lowest waiting times in all areas. developed an exceptional team of executives to head each service directorate who excelled in a well planned environment.

I joined the NHS as a young 16 year old as a clerical officer in the salaries and wages department. Over a period of 8 years I gained experience in audit, human resource management, information, IT before settling on a career in finance, rising through the ranks to Hospital accountant at Christee Hospital in Manchester. From there I moved back to my home in the Midlands, UK to embark on a change in career at the time the resource management initiative was introduced to the NHS. I became one of the first business managers within a clinical setting and this role quickly evolved into general management. during my career I have managed every department one could think off within an acute setting with the exception of heart transplantation. I have worked with many wonderful and experienced people who enabled my career to develop at a rapid rate, whilst some who were not so great also taught me lessons albeit unknowingly at the time.

During This time I held various General Management roles within health care for a period of 9 years

Throughout these early years I have ensured that I have delivered above and beyond that which has been expected and enabled those around me to deliver the same. I have become a health addict, gaining motivation from improving peoples lives and at teh same time being appropriately rewarded

jobs.jobTitle: Accommodating Gel Researcher and Senior Safety Manager
jobs.description: In collaboration with the Mawson Institute, we developed the next stage in Intraocular Lens (IOL) technology which is used to treat individuals who are blinded by cataracts and to treat individuals who are near or far-sighted. In this role I worked in a team of ten that included ophthalmic surgeons to develop a biocompatible material. As one of the key inventors, I provided my experience in material science to design, construct, synthesize and test the product for its chemical, physical, and optical properties. In addition, I researched and developed experiments in-line with the Food and Drug Authority (FDA) and Therapeutic Goods Australia (TGA) to ensure the products approval following the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) documents. It was also my responsibility to liaise with the national and international partners in the logistics of supplying hazardous materials and samples.

jobs.jobTitle: Lead Scientist in Li-Ion Battery Electrolytes
jobs.description: In collaboration with Michigan State University, I lead a team of four that researched and developed new electrolyte solvents to prevent Li-ion rechargeable batteries from crystalising at cold temperatures thus increasing their performance in cold climates. A significant improvement was developed as typically a normal Li-ion battery stops operating at -10oC and with the newly developed material, the battery was able to operate as low as -60oC. Important to the automotive industry as this technology can be implemented into battery powered cars to then allow their operation in snow climates.

In collaboration with BioPlastics Polymers and Composites (BPPC), I developed a product/treatment for the prevention of mastitis in cows for the Dairy Industry with Zoetis, the largest global animal health company. Leading a team of four, I liaised with Zoetis to understand their requirements then designed, constructed, tested, and supplied the new biocompatible product to Zoetis for their further testing.

KTM industries manufactures two products; magic nuudles and green cell foam. This

      decreasing. In this role, I analysed the company, aided the company in finding new
      
      distribution channels and presented new marketing strategies to increase their sales.

general.headline: Barrister at Victorian Bar
general.description:
I am a barrister at the Victorian Bar, with a practice in common law and commercial law. As a solicitor, I worked in commercial law, with a particular focus on property law but also general commercial litigation. I completed my graduate training at Maddocks Lawyers, and worked there as a solicitor until September 2016. From late 2016 to early 2018, I pursued my interest in academia, designing and teaching units for Legal Writing and Legal Profession & Professional Practice (Legal Ethics) at Swinburne University.  While teaching at Swinburne, I continued my involvement in private practice, working intermittently as a contract lawyer at Allens on a number of document review projects and, more recently, at Coulter Roache Lawyers in Geelong in their property law practice. 

I was awarded a Juris Doctor graduate degree from the University of Melbourne in 2014 and received a Certificate of Academic Excellence on completion. 

Before starting my career in law, I worked in marketing, fundraising and business development in the not-for-profit sector. I worked as a major donor fundraiser for Oxfam Australia and have engaged in marketing and fundraising initiatives for several other not-for-profit organisations as a trainer and consultant. 

I have extensive training in communications and marketing, and I maintain a keen interest in business development and client relations.

2014 - Wrote my first crochet pattern and published it on Ravelry as a free download. I saw it was downloaded hundreds of times, which prompted me to get serious about pattern writing. Had the pattern tested and, as a result of excellent feedback from my testers, re-vamped the entire pattern. The upgraded pattern is available for purchase in my Ravelry store.

2015 – January - I have imported my three patterns into Loveknitting’s web site, to make them available to a wider audience, especially customers in Europe. My design efforts are still in a fledgling state and I consider myself a hobbyist, instead of a business. June – I bought another minivan and traveled across the US through several states, visiting relatives and exploring our lovely country. As of September 2015, enjoying an extended stay with a generous relative on her farm in a rural area near Kansas City. I love creating crochet designs, writing patterns, and having them tested. I also love teaching others to crochet. This is the most fun I’ve had in years!

2016 - I have traveled extensively this year and published five more crochet patterns. I have used a tech editor for the first time and she is worth her weight in gold! I have had several patterns tested here on Ravelry and I love the thrill of seeing my designs come off the hooks of my wonderful testers.

2017 - Working on more snowflake hexagon patterns.

See my Ravelry designer page here: http://www.ravelry.com/designers/cheryldeecrochet
See my blog here: https://cheryldeecrochet.com/

jobs.companyName: Housecarers House and Pet Sitting Directory Worldwide
jobs.description: I am experienced in being a responsible homeowner and fully committed to caring for your home and pets as if they were my own. Cats and dogs warm up to me easily and I to them. When you need to leave home, don't turn off your utilities and leave your home empty, taking the risk that you may come back to a house that is truly empty, i.e., all of your possessions gone. Why pay for a security system and put your lights on timers? Any one wanting to break in would soon figure out that there's no one there. Instead, protect your investment in your "castle," by inviting a trustworthy, non-smoking house-carer to live on-site, while you're gone. My references can assure you that I am the house-carer you need to ensure your peace of mind. Go play! Have fun!

general.description:
My approach to development is holistic, encompassing not only what is achieved in the spaces that I facilitate (in groups or individual coaching) but how I can support the complexity of the organisation to work together and make progress on its goals.

I developed a passion for understanding and shaping organisational cultures through individual and collective development early in my career, and have shaped my roles to develop this expertise.

Excellence, collaboration and connection are important values that drive me and show through in the way I coach, manage and facilitate.

Enginuity is a sister company to PRA. The company name is a fusion of the words “engineering” and “ingenuity.”

Ingenuity is defined as “the ability to solve difficult problems, often in original and creative ways;” which is an activity of the creative right brain. Engineering is defined as “the practical application of science to commerce or industry;” which is a more rational activity performed by the practical left hemisphere of the brain.

We fully appreciate that the engineering sector has evolved far beyond just design and build. Our philosophy is simple: Understanding & Precision.

We have the scope to truly understand your engineering requirements and align our services to your needs with precise staffing solutions.

As specialist engineering recruiters we pride ourselves on our resourcefulness, cultivating interest amongst professionals of outstanding talent.

As talent scouts we have the unrivaled ability to expedite access to exclusive job opportunities.

Our knowledge covers:
Upstream & Downstream Oil and Gas

An Import & Export freight forwarding company and market leaders in imports from Europe & Export consignments to south east Asia, FCI handles business both on a national and international level. With FCI I was fortunate to have been given the opportunity to grow and develop over my four years to experience both the operational aspects of the business while also managing my own base of key clients.

As Manager I was responsible for the Sea Freight Division. 

Overseeing all Export Sea & Air operations for Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide & Fremantle paying particular attention to new & existing client quotations, Sailing Schedules, Status Reports, Forwarding arrangements & Cartage.
Managed an export desk, looking after handful of client's nationwide. 

During my time in this division we expanded and the consignments to South East Asia per week steadily increased.

As controller my responsibilities  include;
Managing and developing a bas of Import clients. This involved both Account Management and development of existing clients and also the generation of New Business. 

Due to the strong relationships I developed with my clients, referrals played a key part of New Business Development.

The role involved but wasn't limited to Sea & Air Registration, Arranging Custom documentation, Customs clearing via a broker, Arranging Quarantine, Cartage & Invoicing.

As FCI was experiencing large growth, I was hired as the main customers clerk
      responsible for deliveries and collections, customs inspections & labelling of freight at
      
      depots.

ACL Johnfletcher was a well established Freight forwarding & Brokerage company with a large scale cartage company. At the time of joining they were the bench mark when it comes to your one stop shop (Forwarding, Brokerage & Cartage) Being in the business for over 100 years they had several of largest clients in Sydney i.e. IBM, HP, Nestles, Porsche. 
Starting as the Junior Customs Clerk, my goal was to become full time broker after completing further education. 
My main duties at ACL included registering Import Sea Freight jobs for the company through various in house systems. 
Status reporting between departments on vessel arrivals & departures. 
Updating clients with details on the estimate delivery date & than the actual deliver date. 
My reason for finishing my role here was due to the fact the company went into receivership in June 2002

general.headline: Partner | Barry.Nilsson.
general.description:
Nieva Connell is a partner in our Insurance and Health team and is based in the Melbourne office.

At Barry.Nilsson, Nieva advises clients on insurance claims, as well as on coverage disputes, particularly those involving:

•	Public liability (personal injury and property damage)
•	Professional indemnity (with a special focus on real estate matters)
•	Product liability
•	First party industrial special risks (ISR)
•	Class actions.

Nieva also assists clients with policy interpretation and drafting, claims assessment and statutory compliance issues. Her clients include national, multinational and international insurers.

Nieva is an expert in complex litigation and has defended a number of prominent class actions, including:

•	A Victorian Supreme Court matter that arose when 500 people became ill after consuming soy milk
•	A Victorian Supreme Court matter relating to interruption of the gas supply in Victoria
•	A Federal Court matter, which was later transferred to the Supreme Court of Victoria, relating to the contamination of aviation fuel
•	A Federal Court matter relating to proceedings commenced by protesters under the ‘Occupy Melbourne’ banner.

Nieva is currently defending a party in the Manus Island class action in the Supreme Court of Victoria.

In 2007, Nieva won the Law Institute of Victoria’s Pro Bono Lawyer of the Year Award. In 2015, she was listed in Australasian Lawyer as one of the top 50 women to watch in Australia and New Zealand in the category ‘Experts in Their Field’. Nieva was recognised as a recommended lawyer for public liability and medical negligence in the 2016 edition of Doyle's Guide.

general.headline: Consultant at Pragma Legal
general.description:
Michael graduated as a solicitor in NSW in 1965 and then in WA in 1966. He joined the firm of Robinson Cox in the same year, became partner with that firm, and in due course senior partner of its successor Clayton Utz. After working as a consultant at Sceales & Co, Michael joined Leaker Partners as a senior lawyer, where he maintained a practice in wills, estates and succession matters. In July 2018 Michael joined Pragma Legal as a Consultant. 

Michael is known for his practicality and attention to detail, assisting his clients with suitable documents and a conciliatory approach where necessary. His mission is to be a sound and understanding lawyer to people in need of estate planning advice and the management of deceased estates, and he advocates the use of plain language in the law.

Michael has been Deputy Chairman and Director of the Telethon Kids Institute and Chairman and Director of the Eye Surgery Foundation. 

Practice areas:
•	Will making
•	Estate planning
•	Advice on deceased estates and succession matters
•	Advice on enduring powers of attorney and guardianship

jobs.jobTitle: Digital Record Project and Change Manager

o Leading the development/implementation of ISO31000 risk framework using to assess  compliance across BCP systems; development of audit tools and checklists: Leading the audit and team members: Preparing and completing the compliance audit and assessment, gap analysis and action plan point to bring non-compliance to compliance standards.

o	Identifying change readiness status – to ‘go live’ with the change: addressing identified issues/concerns and managing ‘go live’ for the change date 
o	Embedding change at individual, business and manager through personal engagement and facilitation and conducting post implementation review of change effectiveness and reporting.
Success measure: successful delivery of cultural change program following system upgrade program.

general.headline: Partner at Le Grand Margalit Lawyers
general.description:
Michel Margalit is a plaintiff lawyer. She is dedicated to ensuring each and every client receives carefully considered legal advice and representation.

She practices in TAC, WorkCover, public liability and common law claims including those to recover compensation for victims of violent assault and sexual assault. 

Michel provides her clients with compassionate yet practical advice. She takes a holistic approach to supporting her clients while strenuously advocating on their behalf.

She is an active member of the Victorian Legal Profession. Her professional memberships include the Australian Lawyers Alliance and the Law Institute of Victoria. She sits on the Law Institute of Victoria Workers' Compensation Committee and the Australian Lawyers Alliance Committee.

WorkCover

Testamentary capacity, undue influence and fraud.

During my time with the Cardinia Club I was honoured to win the 'Best Club Bistro in Victoria'. I built a stronger and widespread promotional brand for the venue. My revenue rose by a considerable amount within a short period as well as the venue's overall popularity also increased. My vast career has led me into several different industries and roles, enabling professional growth and education.

I am always actively seeking professional growth and knowledge. My enthusiastic and diverse business mindset, has allowed me in the past and hopefully in the future to continue in various roles in a wide range of industries. 
Please feel free to contact myself for further information and possible new business ventures.

general.headline: Barrister (Victorian Bar); Attorney (NY Bar); Senior Fellow (Melbourne and Monash); Visiting Senior Fellow (NUS)
general.description:
Paul practices full-time as a Barrister (Dever’s List) at the Victorian Bar, Australia. He is also admitted as an Attorney to the New York State Bar, USA. 

Prior to being called to the Bar, Paul worked as a solicitor for several years at Nowicki Carbone, Moray & Agnew, and Wisewould Mahony.

He maintains a varied practice as a barrister, predominantly in the following areas:

- common law (torts, personal injury including Workcover and TAC damages proceedings, serious injury claims, compensation disputes, statutory (s138) recoveries, public and occupiers liability, product liability, medical negligence, superannuation TPD disputes, and accident and sickness insurance);

- sports law (doping, match-fixing, “disrepute”/morality clause disputes, defamation, sports marketing law including ambush marketing, privacy/publicity rights, sporting injuries compensation, and general disciplinary matters);

- international commercial arbitration.

In addition, he teaches Sports Law subjects as a Senior Fellow of the Melbourne Law School and Monash University Law School, and as a Visiting Senior Fellow of the National University of Singapore Faculty of Law.

Paul has Commerce and Law (with Honours) degrees from Monash University, and a Master of Laws from the University of Melbourne.

Paul is widely published on various legal issues.

general.headline: Legal Practitioner 36 years  and Specialist Commercial Mediator
general.description:
With many hundreds of  successfully negotiated an/or litigated outcomes throughout 38 years of private and senior public law practices,  my specialist  mediation practice now offers the services of Julie Nicholson, a Retired Judge and former Deputy Chair of the Racing Appeals Tribunal.

We offer  specialist dispute resolution skills both prior to and after the commencement of proceedings with a focus on:  
◾complex commercial and insurance disputes; and
◾ issues arising in small business, company and partnership disputes; and
◾complaints within all industry sectors involving bullying/harassment  allegations.

We bring proven knowledge and skills gained from Bernard's  roles as a Solicitor Advocate  representing  individuals, families and members of corporate bodies  in mediation or facilitation and Julie's advocacy as a Member of the Bar for 18 years  and in her judicial appointments. 
 Of more recent times, we have achieved  extremely positive outcomes  for parties by way of an involvement in  complex complaints handling processes  with former  staff within the  Australian Olympic Committee and continue similar engagements on behalf of national  sporting bodies  and community organisations.

As  well we bring relevant legal skills to explore issues  and  assist parties  achieve their outcomes through well researched settlement strategies for:
-  Business Succession Planning and Commercial matters;
-  Wills & Estates and Deeds;
-  Guardianship and Trusts
 - Consumer and Trade Practices related claims and Contractual Disputes
-  Partnerships and shareholder disputes;
-   Franchising, Retail Tenancy,  Domestic & Commercial Building 
-  Tribunal hearings arising as Work place disputes, Unfair Dismissal & Anti-Discrimination
-   Sports law including Racing and administrative law.

general.headline: Barrister
general.description:
Dr Michelle Sharpe practices primarily in the area of general commercial and regulatory law, specialising in contract, property and consumer protection law and disciplinary hearings. She regularly appears in all jurisdictions, including VCAT, on her own.

Michelle has a Bachelor of Laws with first class honours from the University of Adelaide and a Doctorate from the University of Melbourne. Michelle’s doctoral thesis examined the doctrines of duress, undue influence, unconscionable conduct and statutory unconscionable conduct. 

Michelle is highly experienced in matters involving breaches of consumer protection law, having acted for (and against) State and Federal agencies. She has written and contributed to papers and publications on consumer protection – particularly in the area of unconscionable conduct. In 2018 Lexis Nexis will be publishing a book authored by Michelle on unconscionable conduct in Australian commercial and consumer contracts.

In 2006 Michelle was the founding member of the Victorian Bar's Health and Wellbeing Committee and during her 9 years on that committee helped to establish a wellbeing program which included a 24/7 counselling service for barristers. This program was a finalist for the Australian Psychological Society Health and Wellbeing Award for 2015.

jobs.description: Paralegal in the Dispute Resolution team

My involvement in Globe's eCommerce team required the development of skills in HTML coding, website management and customer service. I was employed initially in a casual position undertaken simultaneously with my undergraduate degree. After graduating in July 2016,  I accepted a full time contract at Globe which I performed until December of that year.

During my Bachelor of Arts, I was engaged by the Faculty as a Peer Assisted Study Session (PASS) Leader. 
I led two subjects during my undergraduate degree: Law in Social Theory, and Shakespeare in Performance. 

PASS are free weekly study sessions with fellow students led by a high achieving student (PASS Leader) who has successfully completed a subject in the previous year. PASS offers students an opportunity to supplement and enhance their studies by participating in an informal and interactive learning environment. During a PASS session, students compare and clarify lecture notes, review textbook readings, and discuss key course concepts.

This opportunity led me to develop skills including leadership, communication and time management.

The responsibilities of the lifeguarding team at the Brunswick Baths extends from ensuring the safety of all patrons of the centre, to being the front-facing staff representing the centre at all times. This role marries responsibility and approachability, requiring the lifeguards to remain constantly alert to the needs of patrons whilst also requiring a high level of customer service ability. 
After one year of employment as a lifeguard at the centre, I was additionally appointed as a swimming teacher in the junior swimming program. This opportunity enabled me to further develop my customer service and communication skills, requiring that I respond to the needs of young students (3yrs-12yrs old) as well as their parents. 
I continued working concurrently as a lifeguard and swimming teacher until my departure from the centre.

general.headline: Senior Operations Manager at Herbert Smith Freehills
general.description:
Prior to my appointment into the Operations Manager role (April 2009), I was the Brisbane Human Resources Manager at Herbert Smith Freehills,and prior to Herbert Smith Freehills I was the talent acquisition manager at Allen’s Arthur Robinson responsible for Australian and Asia. 

As a Senior Operations Manager, I manage a team of people to deliver operational and large scale change management initiatives that facilitate the effective and efficient running of the Brisbane office, and alignment into the global network.  

I play a lead role in strategy and business transformation involving the review and analysis of business processes and future improvement/change initiatives. Providing advice, recommendations and actions for implementation.  

I also lead Business Continuity Management across Australia and Asia. I hold globally recognised qualifications - CBCI. I am also responsible for physical security across Australia and Asia and take a risk-based approach using a combination of physical and procedural measures designed to prevent or mitigate threats. 

I have an MBA from the University of QLD, undergraduate qualifications in Human Resources Management.   I am fully accredited in Relationship Awareness Theory  (Strength Deployment Inventory – SDI) and I'm also an active Commissioner of Declarations.

general.headline: Technology Curriculum Coordinator (Secretarial) DLA Piper Australia

jobs.description:
Managing the day to day activities of a team of six trainers based around APAC.  This includes the coordination of training, modification and creation of trainer and user resources in various formats, administration activities plus team management duties.
Working closely with IT Managers, HR, PMO and key stakeholders to ensure business training needs are identified/meet and that we are thoroughly aware of and where necessary involved in projects and business changes.
A hands on manager activity involved in all aspects of the trainer role.  Training topics include: Microsoft Office 2010, Autonomy WorkSite, 3e, InterAction, collaboration tools plus other standard and bespoke software and hardware products.
Member of the Environment Committee, Brisbane Women's Network and Values Recognition Programme.
Key achievements:
- Dramatic increase in the number of scheduled courses delivered by the team
- Creation of web based training materials
- In a time frame of 1 year, steered the creation of 18 new courses, revamp of 8 courses, updates to >50% of intranet training resources and additional intranet content
- Formation of training plans, trainer/user resources, training delivery and evaluation for the rollout of but not limited to: WorkShare, ShareFile, GoToMeeting, Lync 2013, Wall Builder, Mitel telephones and new PCs/Laptops/MFD across Australia, Power PDF.  A near entire system upgrade for the PNG office (Win 7, Office 2010, Autonomy WorkSite and InterAction)
- Invented an initiative named IT on the Ground 
- Created new courses to target common Help Desk calls in order to reduce call volume
- Encompassed new training tools: Captivate and GoToMeeting to expand the forum of remote training technologies and web based training materials.  Moved over to a new LMS (Learn) to record all training data
- Implemented a training service in Asia, this has been well received and will continue to evolve

Creation of trainer and user guides (used Australia wide), conducted train the trainer, delivered training, provided floor walking support and carried out associated trainer administration.

Short term contract as an in-house trainer providing IT training to all staff in Auckland and Wellington to ensure a smooth transition to a complete change of all IT systems from practice management to document management over a 5 month period.
Duties include software testing, project management, creation and delivery of training courses, creation of user and trainer guides, conducting new starter IT Inductions, refresher, scheduled and ad hoc training.
IT Training software includes: Microsoft Office 2010, Autonomy Worksite, BigHand, Elite 3e.
Regular floor walking to help ensure smooth project delivery on go live, identify training needs, gain customer feedback and provide instant training fixes.
Administration work includes: organising training, updating training materials and managing self.

Initially started as an IT Trainer then moved into the Business Integration Analyst role.

Business Integration Analyst:
Conduct Usage Gap Analysis and use these finding to write Design and Service Readiness reports.
Act as an end user feeling ‘barometer’ and quality controller with regards to what is delivered to customers to ensure their needs are met.
Provide communication and support using standard PM tools and techniques by ensuring involved/affected Front Line Service (FLS) teams are kept fully informed with regards to service impacting projects and their progress.
Be the contact during pilots, reporting on progress and providing feedback to the project team.
Ensure that all FLS teams’ requirements are met in terms of service readiness before a new product or service goes live.
Propose, schedule and run 'go-live' support and communication plans for project implementations.
Conduct quarterly reviews with customers by various means on new products and services to ensure feedback is captured and actioned.

IT Trainer:
In-house trainer providing training to staff based in Leeds with travel to other UK and overseas offices.  The nature of the training delivered includes scheduled (e.g. new starter IT Inductions), ad hoc training requests, project/rollout training and go live support.
Training on all software and hardware products used at DLA Piper such as: Microsoft Office, Autonomy Worksite, BigHand, InterAction, in-house software products, telephony, laptop and remote access technologies.
Regular departmental floor walking to help identify training needs, gain customer feedback and provide instant training and technical fixes.
Administration work includes: monthly trainer report, training record maintenance, scheduling training, maintaining training materials and writing articles for the quarterly in-house magazine.

general.headline: CEO at MYOB
general.description:
My management career spans the markets of Asia, Europe, the US and Australia. 

A hands on CEO at MYOB, I’m focussed on achieving results.  Through my work at MYOB, I love the opportunities provided to drive fantastic outcomes for clients and team members.

My strengths centre on my capability of developing and driving strategy (particularly when marrying technology and business).

Peter Drucker once wrote, “The CEO is the link between the Inside that is ‘the organization,’ and the Outside of society, economy, technology, markets, and customers. Inside there are only costs. Results are only on the outside.”  I really subscribe to this thought.  My job is to form the link or bridge between the Inside and the Outside of MYOB.

I love the journey we are on at MYOB - helping SMEs build stronger businesses by leveraging the internet. From web hosting to online accounting solutions - we have a great opportunity to bring this vision to life and have a big impact on many businesses.

Doing what feels right is important to me.  In fact the best piece of advice I’ve ever received is…  Never do things that feel wrong. Listen to that inner voice. If something doesn’t feel right, don’t do it.

general.headline: Organisational Development, Change Management, Employee Experience
general.description:
I am an organisational development and change management professional using human centred design principles to create amazing experiences in the moments that matter for employees.

I have worked in the in the Technology and Banking industries for over 15 years.  During that time I have worked in various roles including organisational development, learning and development, change management, strategy, customer experience management, business and project management across Retail, Commercial, Corporate and Institutional sectors at organisational, portfolio and project levels.

jobs.description:
Working directly with the Head of Group Brand & Communications and Organisational Capability Manager, I am responsible for embedding MYOB’s brand values across the company and driving behaviour change.  

Through collaboration with key stakeholders across the business, I have developed strategies and plans to engage and educate team members to drive organisational change.  

This includes the design, development and implementation of a brand education program of facilitated learning and other educational activities tailored to the business needs.  

I have developed and implemented a brand onboarding program for new starters into the MYOB Brand Experience and have developed and drive Reward & Recognition Programs across MYOB.

Leading a team of Change professionals I was accountable for the delivery and sustainability of organisational change across Retail, Corporate, Commercial and Institutional audience groups for the Payments business. 

I was responsible for the planning and estimating of resources required for organisational change management activities as well as the establishment and ongoing management of a change budget as part of a project/program.  Through collaboration with stakeholders I had to understand their needs to determine the appropriate strategies for enabling and embedding project related change.  I developed and implemented change management strategies in conjunction with the change Sponsor addressing individual, team and organisational requirements, organisational obstacles, areas of risk and defined customer impacts.  I had to act as an SME for change management, learning and communication techniques and provide coaching and mentoring as required.

I implemented functionality allowing over 500 merchants to process Private Health Fund and Medicare claims and credit and debit card payments through a single EFTPOS terminal, impacting over 350 banking staff and introduced Union China Pay credit and debit card transactions across EFTPOS and ATM devices impacting 56,000 merchants and up to 200 banking staff.  I also implemented an enhanced merchant facility application on Apple iOS and Android devices enabling up to 10,000 Small Businesses to complete instant credit card transactions. 

I conducted an impact analysis and development of change strategies for the introduction of mobile wallet applications for credit cards on various mobile operating systems impacting over 1 million customers as well as the introduction of new system for 1,000 consultants to service customer queries.

general.headline: Senior Learning & Organisational Development Consultant (currently on Parental Leave)
general.description:
An accomplished and future focused Organisational Development professional with over 13 years’ experience working across industries including engineering, tech and banking. Penelope’s experience spans the full spectrum of ‘People & Culture’ including Human Resources and Learning & Development with specialist skills in Organisational Development, Employee Engagement and Leadership.

She has particular expertise and a passion for feeding company culture with innovative and holistic solutions that enable organisational success whilst inspiring and challenging team members.
Prior to SEEK where she is the Senior Organisational Development & Learning Consultant, she was the Senior Capability Manager for Bupa Digital and before that spent 7 years at MYOB. 
Whilst at MYOB the team won the annual Culture Transformation Award from Human Synergistics.

Penelope utilises Human Centred Design and Agile methodologies to challenge the way that culture is formed, enabled and embedded. The focus is on putting people (rather than processes) back at the centre of ‘Human Resources’ blended with a desire for people to truly love what they do and where they do it.

jobs.description:
The Data & Digital team is all about sustainably reinventing and disrupting ourselves by building a cross-functional design & deliver department. We’re doing this by addressing our ways of working (we’re design led and Agile run), customer centricity and technical flexibility.

We combine human-centred design with agile and lean methodologies to be rapid and effective.

I am responsible for developing skills, knowledge and tool sets and empowering mind-sets to build knowledge and deliver new capability through the use of new Ways of Working.

general.headline: Chief Employee Experience Officer at MYOB
general.description: I am an accomplished executive with a proven track record of delivery in transformational roles.  With an authentic leadership style and courage in new and challenging business contexts, I've demonstrated strong career agility via multi-sector, multi-discipline and multi-national experience and success. I'm driven by a genuine desire to see organisations, and the individuals within them, succeed.

jobs.description:
The Enterprise Services team drives Telstra’s ‘Future Ways of Working’ initiatives, whilst also providing key internal services for the organization.  

FWOW is Telstra’s internal workplace transformation programme, with a vision to “become a leader in personal productivity and collaboration by living our core values, unleashing our teams’ talents and showcasing our market-leading technologies to deliver better customer outcomes.”  This programme includes initiatives across workplace, technology and behavioural change, making a significant contribution to developing Telstra’s leadership in this area.   As Executive Lead since Jan 2013, I have developed expertise in this newly evolving area of workplace strategy, and demonstrated the ability to lead the organization through the required change journey.  

The wider Enterprise Services team includes a team of 600 employees delivering Internal Telecommunications Services, Executive Support Services and a host of site-based/administrative services including Records Management, Guest Services, etc.  This group seeks to simplify and improve internal policies and processes, taking advantage of the FWOW tools and technologies to enhance productivity and internal service delivery.

Led Organisational Development and held responsibility for the delivery of people
      initiatives at the heart of Telstra's change journey.  The portfolio included Talent,
      Learning & Development, Performance, Diversity and Inclusion, Leadership, Employee
      
      Engagement and Culture change.

UGL was an ASX-listed, diversified Engineering and Property services business with divisions in Infrastructure, Rail, Resources and Property Services.  With revenues of $4.5bn and 43 000 people globally, UGL had a market capitalization of $2.5bn.  Here I led the Global HR team (team of 7), with functional responsibility for the delivery of HR (via team of 250) across the various business divisions in Australia, Asia, Middle East and the USA.

A $5billion revenue business, with EBIT at $773million (2007 published results), the Australasian business was a significant contributor to the BAT Global Group’s performance.  With 2200 employees and manufacturing sites across the markets of Australia, New Zealand, Papua New Guinea, Solomon Islands, Fiji and Samoa, I led the HR function across the business (26 in Australia, 12 across New Zealand & South Pacific) at a time of significant positive growth and transformation.  I also led a series of Productivity initiatives delivering $24m in cost savings over a 2 year period (2006-2008)

general.headline: Accredited Specialist in Personal Injury Law
general.description:
John is a lawyer with more than 20 years of experience in Personal Injury Law & Litigation.

John is accredited by the Law Institute of Victoria as an Accredited Specialist in Personal Injury Law.

John acts on behalf of people who suffer personal injury including workers injured in the course of employment, transport accident victims and those who suffer injury in a public place.

John specialises in all aspects of Personal Injury Law & Litigation including WorkCover Common Law Damages claims, Transport Accident Common Law Damages claims & Public Liability Damages claims.

John is recognised as the leading WorkCover Compensation Plaintiff Lawyer in Victoria, Australia in 2016, 2017 & currently by Doyle’s List.

John is also a member of the Law Institute of Victoria WorkCover committee and Secretary of the Victorian branch of the Australian Lawyers Alliance.

John’s career highlights includes obtaining 2 separate jury verdicts of in excess of $1 million dollars in compensation for injuries sustained by his client as a result of the negligence of the defendant. John has also obtained a jury verdict of $250,000 for pain & suffering for his client who sustained severe injury to both ankles as a result of the negligence of the defendant.

John has negotiated settlements for his clients for monies which total in excess of $50,000,000.

John is an expert in the negotiation and resolution of complex injury claims.

John is a passionate advocate for his clients and loves “ fighting the good fight “.

general.headline: Lawyer at Maurice Blackburn Lawyers
general.description:
Lloyd Toffolon is a personal injury compensation lawyer in Maurice Blackburn’s Ringwood office.

Lloyd has a Bachelor of Arts and Bachelor of Laws from Deakin University. He joined Maurice Blackburn in 2014. Lloyd helps people injured on the roads and at work with WorkCover, TAC and related compensation claims.

“I became a lawyer to achieve justice for those who are often vulnerable and disenfranchised,” says Lloyd.

“I’m inspired to advocate for those members in society who have been injured on the roads or at work to ensure they receive the best possible outcome. The most satisfying part of my job is making a positive difference to my clients’ lives when I settle their claim.”

Lloyd is a keen on- and off-road motorcyclist and supporter of Maurice Blackburn’s Sorry Mate I Didn’t See You (SMIDSY) motorcycle safety campaign.

“Having been exposed to the increased dangers as a motorcyclist and to the many hazards we face on the roads, I am able to empathise with the riders who are injured.

“I have a strong interest in changing policies and laws so they better represent motorcyclists’ interests on the road. Being a road safety lawyer and a rider puts me in a better position to understand the impact of any proposals to design safer roads or legislative changes to enhance road safety.”

In addition to being an enthusiastic rider and MotoGP fanatic, Lloyd plays football for the Balwyn Tigers.
