general.headline: Workplace Law Professor at RMIT University; Consultant at Corrs Chambers Westgarth
general.description:
Anthony is a Consultant with the Corrs Chambers Westgarth Workplace Relations Group. He oversees the firm’s thought leadership in workplace relations and work health and safety, publishing regular articles on new legislation, case law and policy, as well as delivering seminars to clients and in-house. He also provides practical advice to corporate and public sector clients on employment and workplace relations issues.

He is also a Law Professor in the Graduate School of Business & Law, RMIT University. Anthony teaches Labour Law, Introduction to the Australian Legal System and Legal Research in the Juris Doctor Program at RMIT. His research interests cover collective bargaining, union recognition and good faith bargaining, workplace dispute resolution, trade unions (with a current focus on the Royal Commission on Trade Union Governance and Corruption), comparative labour law, workplace privacy/social media and workplace bullying. 

Anthony recently completed a Fair Work Commission-funded study of the tribunal’s involvement in the enterprise bargaining process; an in-depth study of the 2011-12 Qantas dispute; an overview of Australian workplace privacy law for the Japan Institute for Labour Policy; and contributed to a comparative study of how individual employment disputes are resolved in 10 countries for the International Labour Organization.

Current projects include a preliminary study of the Fair Work Commission's anti-bullying jurisdiction; a paper with Professor John Howe on the operation of majority support determinations under the Fair Work Act; and work with co-authors on the 6th edition of Creighton & Stewart's Labour Law (to be published by Federation Press).

I am the National Practice Leader of Maurice Blackburn's Superannuation and Insurance Claims and Litigation Department, Australia's largest practice of its kind. I am the Division Head of the Personal Legal Services Division which includes superannuation, insurance, financial advice disputes, wills and estates. I convene the firm's National Women's Network and in June 2018 I was named Lawyer's Weekly Partner of the Year for Insurance Law. 

I joined Maurice Blackburn in 1991 after completing my articles and have remained a proud member of the firm, becoming a Principal in July 1999.  As an experienced litigator, I am passionate about achieving fair outcomes for everyday Australians who have suffered injury or illness or who have had to stop work for any medical reason. I strive to provide accurate and clear advice to my clients and a pathway through a period of extreme stress, anxiety and social, work and family disruption.

I am an accredited personal injury specialist.  I previously practised in the areas of WorkCover and personal injury law, and now practise in Superannuation and Insurance claims and litigation.

jobs.jobTitle: Principal, Superannuation & Insurance National Team Leader
jobs.description:
I have provided legal advice including on issues relating to :
•	non-disclosure claims
•	litigating TPD benefits ranging from $25,000 to over $1million
•	advising in matters where there is no insurance due to a failure by employers to pay compulsory superannuation, and
•	recovery of income protection benefits and death benefits.

I have also provided advice to clients in general insurance matters including in flood and mould. I am determined to fight hard for my clients against unfair and unreasonable decisions made by insurers and super funds, and understand the significant financial pressure and strain brought about by an injury, unexpected illness or disability or unexpected event that causes damage to homes.

I was successful in the County Court in the matter of Guirgis v Westpac Life Insurance which I subsequently successfully defended on appeal to the Victorian Full Court of Appeal in 2015. 

I am coconvenor of the firm's Womens'​ Network, a member of the Law Institute of Victoria's Personal Injury Law Advisory Committee and a member of the Australian Litigation Lawyers Alliance.

I established the Ringwood office of Maurice Blackburn in July 1997.  The office has
      expanded significantly and is a cornerstone of the Ringwood community, providing
      advice and representation to injured people in the eastern region from Box Hill to

Zaparas Lawyers was established by my father, Peter Zaparas, nearly 40 years ago. We pride ourselves in being Personal Injury experts and believe in providing comprehensive advice, achieving the best results and doing everything possible to maximise fair and just compensation for our clients.

The legal process for injured workers can be overwhelming and stressful. I pride myself in being able to apply empathy and experience to achieve the best results for my clients.

Coming from a commercial background I have had the opportunity to use my knowledge in developing and implementing business plans and procedures and plans for business growth within the firm.

Zubair Mian, Vice President

Admitted in 1986 after graduating from Melbourne University in 1985, Zubair Mian is the Principal and owner of Mian Phillips & Co, a boutique suburban practice established in 1988, currently in Surrey Hills and practising in commercial litigation, Property, Wills, Probate and estate Planning. The northern boundaries are the Eastern Freeway, Thompsons Road, Warrandyte Road and Kangaroo Ground – St Andrews Road.  It has over (1700) one thousand seven hundred members. Zubair is registered mentor with the Law Institute of Victoria (LIV) mentoring programm, Asian Australian Lawyers Association and has been informally mentoring young lawyers in private practice since 1995. In 2014 Zubair received Law Institute of Victoria service award.

general.headline: Social Justice Lawyer at Maurice Blackburn Lawyers
general.school: Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies
general.description:
Nicki has a mix of global and domestic legal experience, including significant skills in international human rights law and human rights advocacy. After completing Honours in Law and a Bachelor of Arts from the University of Melbourne, Nicki completed a Masters in Law (LLM), for which she was awarded a distinction in International Law at the Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies in Geneva, Switzerland. 

While in Geneva, Nicki also completed an internship at the United Nations Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights. Nicki also co-runs an Australian NGO based in Tanzania, providing sustainable employment for HIV positive women. 

At Maurice Blackburn, Nicki is currently working on the class action for people seeking asylum who we allege were unlawfully detained in Australian immigration detention centres between 2011-2017.

jobs.description:
Maurice Blackburn was founded on the belief that the law should serve everyone, not just those who can afford it. The firm's Social Justice Practice challenges the excesses of government and business, and champions the rights of those who are disadvantaged, particularly refugees and asylum seekers.

Nicki's work at Maurice Blackburn has included the following cases:
- Christmas Island class action (A.S v Minister for Immigration and Border Protection)
- Unlawful detention of people seeking asylum (DBE17 v Minister for Immigration and Border Protection)

SEW is a social enterprise based in Arusha, Tanzania and an Australian NGO. It provides
      HIV+ women with stable, sustainable employment. Through SEW, our sewing mamas
      are leading the fight against the discrimination and prejudice they faced in their local
      
      communities.

general.headline: Associate at MinterEllison
general.description:
Shona is an Associate at MinterEllison.

Shona advises on complex sale and lease agreements for commercial and retail assets, industrial properties, office premises and airport facilities.

Her primary areas of practice include property development and projects, acquisitions and disposals and commercial leasing.

Shona has been involved in negotiating large scale property development agreements for clients such as University of Melbourne and Qantas as well as sale and lease agreements for commercial and industrial properties for national aggregators including DEXUS, AMP and Charter Hall.

Shona has been involved in a number of high profile asset acquisitions including for AMP Capital’s unlisted A$700 million Wholesale Australian Property Fund, AVEO Group, and Baby & Child Food Co Ltd (China's biggest infant food manufacturers). 

Shona’s property practice is overlayed with experience in and a broad understanding of commercial law, having worked as in-house legal counsel for Spotlight Retail Group and as a secondee to Gold Coast 2018 Commonwealth Games.

general.headline: Management Consultant
general.description:
I started my first business in 2011, and have been solving real-world problems in various contexts ever since. I successfully scaled my education start-up and then became a full-time problem solver for strategy consulting firms in Melbourne and Sydney. I launched, operated and exited businesses in the e-commerce and hospitality sectors while helping senior executives solve pressing problems within their own organisations.

I enjoy working on challenging business problems with great people. Please feel free to get in touch if you think you have a problem I'd enjoy.

jobs.description:
Launched Melbourne's first dedicated poké store.
      

    After a period of testing, we have begun expanding the brand across Australia, and
      have established eight stores across Melbourne and Sydney.
      

    
      We were also voted as the Best New Concept in the QSR Media Awards 2018.

Started Australia's first and fastest growing cold plate ice creamery with Justin Huang. We grew the brand from the ground up despite having no prior hospitality experience. We exited the business to focus on other opportunities after laying the foundations for success and establishing two branches (including a flagship store in Chadstone Shopping Centre).

In 2011, I co-founded Connect Education, the first student-run lecture organisation in Australia. My involvement in Connect has been focused on business development and sales. As part of my role, I have authored three print publications, and have presented content to thousands of students across Victoria. In 2016, I I transitioned out of an active role and took up a position on the Board of Advisors.
Highlights of my accomplishments are below.
• Secured partnerships with multiple institutions, including Balwyn High School, Monash University and Teach for Australia
• Presented 4.5 hour seminars to over 2,000 participants
• Developed and published content for high school Mathematics, Economics and Accounting

I have completed projects across a wide variety of industries and geographies, with a clear focus on the financial services and private equity sectors. 
Fast-tracked promotion to Senior Business Analyst. 

Key project highlights:
• For a leading general insurer, developed a capital management strategy to optimise allocation of capital processes to increase shareholder value
• For a leading private equity owned digital search firm, completed a project to deliver a customer retention strategy to reduce churn, that has been implemented 
• For a leading private equity owned agribusiness, completed a vendor due diligence, assessing the market position of the organisation
• For a leading financial institution, completed a diagnostic of the mortgages business, helping to identify key areas for improvement

Full project history is available on request.
